lowPrint

@Deprecated
public void lowPrint(java.lang.String text,
                                Colour colour)
Deprecated. Helper method only meant to be used by

Note: Don't override me! Override print(java.lang.String, com.n9mtq4.console.lib.utils.Colour) instead
Note: Don't use me!
A small helper method that BaseConsole calls. This method adds support for default text color.

Parameters:
text - the text
colour - the colour
See Also:
print(java.lang.String, com.n9mtq4.console.lib.utils.Colour)

print

public void print(java.lang.String text,
                  @Nullable
                  Colour colour)
Note: Override me!
Called when a ConsoleListener wants to print something.

Parameters:
text - The string that the user wants to print that should be handled
colour - The colour that the user wants to print the text in. If colour is null, it will be automatically set to the defaultTextColour, however, if you haven't given defaultTextColour a colour be prepared for colour to be null
See Also:
setDefaultTextColour(com.n9mtq4.console.lib.utils.Colour), getDefaultTextColour()

printImage

Note: Override me!
Called when a ConsoleListener wants to print an image.

Parameters:
file - the file

getDefaultTextColour

public Colour getDefaultTextColour()
Gets the default text colour to use when one is not specified
If you called setDefaultTextColour - no need to do anything. It's handled on a lower level.

Returns:
The colour that is the default colour to be used when one isn't specified
See Also:
setDefaultTextColour(com.n9mtq4.console.lib.utils.Colour)

setDefaultTextColour

public void setDefaultTextColour(Colour defaultTextColour)
Sets the default text colour to use when one is not specified
The super class will set the colour in print to whatever is set here - no need to do anything. It's handled on a lower level.

Parameters:
defaultTextColour - The colour that is the default colour to be used when one isn't specified
See Also:
getDefaultTextColour()
